column4: i have added the line "05 19   * * *   phanindraramesh shutdown" to the file /etc/crontab. is the system supposed to shut down at 7:05 pm for the user "phanindraramesh"??
i have added the line "05 19   * * *   phanindraramesh shutdown" to the file /etc/crontab. is the system supposed to shut down at 7:05 pm for the user "phanindraramesh"??
a user might not be able to run the shutdown command..
what shall i do to run the command?
what shall i do to run the shutdown command?
never needed to..  you can make cron jobs that run as the root user i belive...
your use of the term 'for every user' makes no sence.. if the pc shutdowns.. its down...
you did do a ./configure first?
yeah. I did
perhaps it failed
id run the ./configure again and see if it has any errors
I have done it again. But the same error again
pay attention to its output
, ./configure gave no errors. hjave a look at it http://pastebin.com/8JNjzgUf
i just copy mine to my .fonts directory ;)
if I do so. Will I be able to find out the reason why it is not getting installed?
no idea. try to load it and see if it works.  ive never tried any other  'installers' for ttf fonts.
you could run fontviewer from a terminal, and try to load/install the font and look for error messages in the terminal
what is the command to run fontviewer from a terminal?
no idea.
gnome-font-viewer worked for me
